text:
Links: Publisher (DOI) · Open Access PDF

title: Model-Based Geostatistical Methods Enable Efficient Design and Analysis of Prevalence Surveys for Soil-Transmitted Helminth Infection and Other Neglected Tropical Diseases
text:
Authors: Olatunji Johnson; Claudio Fronterre; Benjamin Amoah; Antonio Montresor; Emanuele Giorgi; Nicholas Midzi; Masceline J. Mutsaka-Makuvaza; Ibrahim Kargbo-Labor; Mary H. Hodges; Yaobi Zhang; Collins Okoyo; Charles Mwandawiro; Mark Minnery; Peter J. Diggle

title: Model-Based Geostatistical Methods Enable Efficient Design and Analysis of Prevalence Surveys for Soil-Transmitted Helminth Infection and Other Neglected Tropical Diseases
text:
Summary
Shows how MBG-based survey design and analysis can outperform WHO guideline methods, using STH surveys in Kenya, Sierra Leone, and Zimbabwe—achieving improved precision with less field effort.

text:

title: About me
text:
I’m a Lecturer in Statistics in the Department of Mathematics at The University of Manchester. I was formerly a post-doctoral researcher and PhD student at CHICAS, Lancaster Medical School, Lancaster University (UK). My PhD was supervised by Prof. Peter Diggle, Prof. Emanuele Giorgi and Prof. Jo Knight.
My research develops novel Model-based Geostatistical (MBG) methods to provide valuable answers to many global public health questions and support informed decision-making in low-resource settings. I have worked and currently working on several global public health problems including COPD, malaria and neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) such as river blindness, soil-transmitted helminths, schistosomiasis, Trachoma, Loiasis.

title: About me
text:
Research areas

Methods: Model-based geostatistics, non-stationary Gaussian processes, spatio-temporal inference, uncertainty quantification

Applications: NTDs, vaccination coverage, decision support (risk maps & exceedance probabilities)

Software: Reproducible tools & teaching apps in R/Python (MBG workflows, visualization)

title: MBGapp: A Shiny application for teaching model-based geostatistics to population health scientists
text:
Authors: Olatunji Johnson; Claudio Fronterre; Peter J. Diggle; Benjamin Amoah; Emanuele Giorgi
Journal: PLOS ONE, 16(12):e0262145 (2021)

title: MBGapp: A Shiny application for teaching model-based geostatistics to population health scientists
text:
Summary
Introduces MBGapp, an R/Shiny tool that walks learners through the full MBG workflow (exploration → variogram → model fitting → prediction) using a Loa loa case study, plus a companion VariagramApp for teaching Gaussian processes.
